pullrequest.title: Add -std=c++11 flag to sdf_config.cmake.in and sdformat.pc.in, needed by downstream code

content.raw:
Yes, I understand what we can consider the standard case. I was thinking in a corner case where a downstream software using sdformat is 'forced' to use c++11 via pkgconfig when it does not require it, nor the part of sdformat in use.

Since it is not a common practice in pkgconfig files installed in the system, I believe that developers leave the responsibility of adding the flag to downstream project.

If Ian is right, and we are using it in Types.hh, which is probably being included from most of the project, then the corner case becomes almost impossible.
